thread.title: Police begin manhunt after Karen Ristevski decomposing body discovered - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Police begin manhunt after Karen Ristevski decomposing body discovered - Yahoo7

author: News On February
title: Police begin manhunt after Karen Ristevski decomposing body discovered - Yahoo7
text:
Share Police begin manhunt after Karen Ristevski decomposing body discovered - Yahoo7 The mysterious case of Karen Ristevski has gripped Victorian’s since she vanished eight months ago – now the hunt for her killer begins. Close Body of missing mother Karen Ristevski discovered in VIC bushland UP NEXT VIDEO Body of missing mother Karen Ristevski discovered in VIC bushland. Source: Seven News Body of missing mother Karen Ristevski discovered in VIC bushland 
Since the Melbourne mum disappeared on June 29, her husband, Borce, and their daughter Sarah led the public appeal to find the 46 year old. 
The investigation enthralled media outlets and consumed detectives who would take CCTV footage home to study overnight, hoping they would find a breakthrough. 
Worst fears were confirmed on Tuesday when police identified a decomposing body found in Victorian bush-land as Ms Ristevski. Karen Ristevski (middle), pictured with her husband and daughter. Picture: 7 News Police at the Mount Macedon scene. Picture: 7 News 
Forensic tests were used to identify her corpse, and the news was passed on to her Avondale Heights family on Tuesday. 
While her husband and stepson both faced tough questioning since her disappearance, police are yet to formally identify any suspects in her death. Remains found in bushland confirmed to be Karen Ristevski 
The manhunt for murderer will now see police knock on doors close to where her body was discovered in Mount Macedon Regional Park on Monday. 
A comprehensive list of friends, family and associates has been drawn up and intensive questioning is set to take place in coming days. 
The grim finding has shocked locals in Mount Macedon, with the body discovered close to numerous houses and a golf course. 
Local cafe and post office owner Brad Eshuys said many people use the park. Karen Ristevski with her husband. Picture: 7 News Police confirmed remains found in bushland are that of Karen Ristevski. Picture: 7 News 
"It's unsettling it was so close to a residential area in an area that is well used by the locals," he told AAP. 
"I think bushwalkers would go through there, maybe mountain bikers, but not many vehicles. It's not a road to anywhere." 
Police conducted a line search at the scene on Tuesday, and have urged anyone with information about suspicious activity in the area to come forward. Timeline of Karen Ristevski mystery Karen Ristevski was last seen at her Avondale Heights home about 10am on June 29. She had not used her phone or bank accounts since she went missing. Her husband Borce and step-son Anthony were questioned by police but released. Police drained dams and searched the same road where Adrian Bayley buried Jill Meagher. On February 20, human remains found at Mt Macedon, about 25km from where police were searching for Ms Ristevski Forensic tests confirmed decaying body was Karen Ristevski on February 21. Close Melbourne mother missing more than seven months UP NEXT VIDEO Melbourne mother missing since June 2016 Melbourne mother missing more than seven months 
- With AAP.
